summary: The Stop Fentanyl Money Laundering Act of 2025 aims to combat illicit fentanyl and narcotics financing. It grants the Secretary of the Treasury authority to implement special measures against financial institutions and transactions outside the U.S. involved in such activities. The bill mandates advisories from the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to financial institutions regarding Chinese money laundering facilitating fentanyl trafficking, and requires the Director of the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to issue guidance on reporting suspicious transactions related to narcotics trafficking by transnational criminal organizations. The Director will prioritize research into these reports and brief Congress.
